page.title: 19Ecology of Saxilby Area
page.content: Modern machinery can transform the landscape overnight! In Saxilby and Broxholme work has commenced on the Lincoln Flood Alleviation Scheme. In a special ceremony on October 15th 1985 the Mayor of Lincoln cut the first turf in Saxilby. Site buildings and excavators had already arrived in many fields. 2.98 square kilometres of washland will be created by the River Till, comprising a shallow earth embankment across the river valley with a sluice on the river to control the flow of water passing downstream. The majority of the time the washlands will be farmed normally. Decision to use the washlands would be at the Water Authority's discretion, maybe only once in 100 years. It will be the largest scheme of its kind in the country.
